text.text_translated: Religion is very important to Pi. Although his family is Hindu, he is curious about other religions and makes friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. To everyone's surprise, Pi declares that he is a Hindu, a Muslim and a Christian simultaneously. When his family and teachers ask him to choose just one religion, Pi refuses, saying 'I just want to love God'. From that moment, they decide to let him make his own mind up about religion.
